text: Terrance Dicks (14 April 1935 - 29 August 2019) was an English author and former television screenwriter, script editor and producer. Dicks had a long association with the BBC science-fiction series Doctor Who, also working as a writer and script editor from 1968 to 1974. He was known as "the most prolific contributor to Doctor Who". Terrance died at his home in Hampstead, London after he short-illness on 29 August 2019 at the age of 84. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1935 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in London Category:English television writers Category:English television producers Category:English children's writers Category:English novelists Category:BBC people Category:Writers from Essex Category:People from East Ham
title: Terrance Dicks
